questions.question: Which of the following words is NOT a noun?

choices.answer: dog
ate
dinner
kitchen

questions.question: (Select the answer that does NOT apply.) A noun is the name of a:

choices.answer: person
action
place
thing

questions.question: How can a noun be used in a sentence.  Choose INCORRECT answer.

choices.answer: direct object
subject
verb
object of the preposition

questions.question: Adjectives modify nouns and...

choices.answer: all verbs
"to be," "like," or "feel" verbs
all past tense verbs
all past perfect tense verbs

questions.question: Choose the correct application of the "to be," "like," or "feel" rule for adjectives.

choices.answer: Daniel felt happily.
Daniel had felt very happily.
Daniel feels happily.
Daniel felt happy.

questions.question: Adverbs describe how and ...

choices.answer: to what extent
nouns
only present tense verbs
proper nouns

questions.question: Which of the following parts of speech do adverbs NOT modify?

choices.answer: verbs
adjectives
other adverbs
nouns

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a correct usage of adverbs?

choices.answer: My mother is partially Asian.
She partially Asians.
As an Asian, she is partially.
Partially Asians are nice.

questions.question: Which of the following is punctuated according to MLA style?

choices.answer: I brought a portable chair, mask, and hand sanitizer to early voting.
I brought a portable chair, mask and hand sanitizer to early voting.
I brought a portable chair, mask, and hand sanitizer: to early voting.
I brought a portable chair: mask; and hand sanitizer to early voting.

questions.question: Which of the following reflects correct punctuation?

choices.answer: I took these items to early voting, chair, mask, and hand sanitizer.
I took these items to early voting: chair, mask, and hand sanitizer.
I took theses items to early voting chair, mask, and hand sanitizer.
I took these items to early voting; chair, mask, and hand sanitizer.

questions.question: Choose two correctly punctuated answers.

choices.answer: It was cold this morning my car wouldn't start.
It was cold this morning. My car wouldn't start.
It was cold this morning, my car wouldn't start.
It was cold this morning; my car wouldn't start.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence.

choices.answer: It is i who has loved you all along.
It is I who has loved you all along.
she has loved you all along.
Frederick has loved you all along

questions.question: The United states Senate is debating Trump's Supreme court pick. ï»¿Which should be capitalized?

choices.answer: "states" only
"states" and "court"
"court" only
"states" and "pick"

questions.question: Which sentence needs capitalization of a proper noun?

choices.answer: Catholicism is based in Vatican City.
Martin Luther founded protestantism.
The White House is located on Pennsylvania Avenue.
I love movies featuring Lassie the Collie dog.

questions.question: Select the correctly worded sentence.

choices.answer: Roberta read so beautiful at Grandpa's funeral.
Roberta read beautiful and good at Grandpa's funeral.
Roberta read so good at Grandpa's funeral.
Roberta read so beautifully at Grandpa's funeral.

questions.question: Select the correct sentence.

choices.answer: I felt prettily in my new dress.
I felt pretty in my new dress.
I am prettily in my new dress.
I looked prettily in my new dress.

questions.question: Select TWO correct sentences.

choices.answer: I felt bad about what I said.
I felt badly about what I said.
I felt badly due to a bandaged hand.
I felt so badly about what I said.

questions.question: Select the correctly punctuated sentence.

choices.answer: Tax records revealed massive U.S. tax fraud.
"The apprentice" reality show launched Donald Trump.
"The Art of the deal" was written by a ghost writer.

questions.question: Select the correctly punctuated sentence.

choices.answer: The Center for Disease Control (CDC) was pressured by the white House.
The White House pressured the center for Disease Control.
The CDC was forced to downplay the virus risk to schoolchildren.
Scientists at the cdc were compromised by the White House.

questions.question: Select the correctly worded sentence.

choices.answer: The wildfires raged dangerously.
The wildfires ranged dangerous.
The wildfires consumed bad across California.
The wildfires ranged badly across California.

questions.question: True or False: Adverbs may modify other adverbs.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: True or False: Adverbs may modify verbs.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: True or False: Adverbs may modify adjectives.

choices.answer: True
False

questions.question: Select the correct punctuation.

choices.answer: Mexico City's museum of Anthropology is a "must see."
Mexico City's Museum of Anthropology is a "must see."
Mexico city's Museum of Anthropology is a "must see."
mexico City's Museum of Anthropology is a "must see."

questions.question: Select the correctly punctuated sentence.

choices.answer: My favorite months are June, October and December.
My favorite months are June, October, and December.
My favorite Months are June, October, and December.
My Favorite months are June, October, and December.
